rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: The company runs as a school. Programs, semesters, coursework, grades.
THE FRAME
A 3-4 person company has a fundamental organizational problem:
everything is interconnected, everyone does multiple things,
and there's no natural way to chunk work into manageable units.
The School Model solves this. The company runs like a school:
SEMESTERS = Natural time-boxing (12-week sprints)
PROGRAMS = Functional groupings (6 core programs)
COURSES = Specific TUPs within a program
GRADES = Performance measurement (A-F, same as Trade Scorecard)
ENROLLMENT = Who is taking what courses this semester
The CEO operates in three modes:
STUDENT: Executing coursework (doing the actual work)
TEACHER: Documenting and delegating (teaching others to do the work)
DEAN: Making architectural decisions (designing programs and courses)
Every employee is a student executing TUPs (courses) under programs.
The ODD is the curriculum. The Trade Scorecard is the transcript.
THE SIX PROGRAMS
Program
1. Product & Supply
rows.col_3: Manufacturing, inventory, fulfillment, QC, supplier management

rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: 2. Growth & Acquisition
rows.col_3: Paid ads, VSLs, organic content, UGC, creator pipeline, landing pages

rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: 3. Retention & Revenue
rows.col_3: Email flows, subscription, loyalty, customer support, LTV optimization

rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: 4. Finance & Legal
rows.col_3: Bookkeeping, cash flow, entity, contracts, compliance, tax

rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: 5. People & Culture
rows.col_3: Hiring, onboarding, performance, compensation, delegation depth

rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: 6. Strategy & Intelligence
rows.col_3: Market research, competitive analysis, product roadmap, Trade Scorecard

rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: SCHOOL ROLES
School Role
Dean
rows.col_4: Designs programs, sets curriculum (ODD), hires faculty, reviews transcripts

rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: Department Chair
rows.col_4: Manages enrollment, coordinates across programs, escalates to Dean

rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: Professor
rows.col_4: Teaches specific courses, documents processes, creates coursework

rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: Student (Senior)
rows.col_4: Takes advanced courses, teaches introductory courses, executes TUPs

rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: Student (Junior)
rows.col_4: Takes assigned courses, executes specific TUPs, reports grades

rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: Compliance Monitor
rows.col_4: Tracks grades, verifies enrollment, enforces academic standards

rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: WHY THIS FRAME WORKS
1. NATURAL TIME-BOXING: Semesters create urgency and reflection cycles.
You can't drift forever. Every 12 weeks, you grade and re-enroll.
2. ROLE CLARITY: Everyone knows if they're a student, teacher, or dean
at any given moment. The Operator is MOSTLY a student (executing)
but shifts to teacher when documenting and to dean when proposing strategy.
3. PROGRESS IS VISIBLE: Transcripts show exactly where the company is.
Which programs are A-grade? Which are failing? Where are the gaps?
4. DELEGATION IS ENROLLMENT: When you delegate work, you're enrolling
someone in a course. The ODD tab is the syllabus. The milestones are
the assignments. The Trade Scorecard is the grade.
5. SCALABLE: Adding a person = enrolling a new student. The curriculum
already exists. They just take courses.
